pageContext.description: The tip fragment from a Middle to Late Bronze Age copper-alloy spear head dating from about 1550 BC to 800 BC. It is in the form of a narrow isosceles triangle with a rib down the centre of each face. In section it is lozenge shaped with a rounded central rib. The patina is rough and dark-brown in colour, though there are a number of areas where the green of copper corrosion has broken through the patina. It is 53mm in length, 19.4mm wide, and 6.6mm thick. It weighs 14.79gm. See Moore & Rowlands, Bronze Age Metalwork in Salisbury Museum, Plate 12, No. 65, and The British Museum's Guide to the Antiquities of The Bronze Age, 2nd edition, Plate 8, No 7.
